name: Pico de Gallo Norteño
description: We've been doing some research around the office on salsas (more on this later), trying various bottled brands to see which we like most. But nothing beats a bowl of the homemade stuff, so we thought we'd share one of...
recipeIngredient: 2 to 4 fresh chilies, either jalapeño or serrano, tops removed but not seeded
4 large ripe, red tomatoes, peeled but not seeded (about 2 1/2 pounds)
6 to 8 scallions with some of the green tops
1/4 cup loosely packed fresh cilantro leaves

recipeInstructions.text: Chop chilies very fine. Mince garlic. Coarsely chop tomatoes. Finely chop scallions and cilantro.

Place garlic, tomatoes, scallions, and cilantro in a large bowl. If tomatoes are dry and juiceless, gradually add up to 1/2 cup cold water to achieve a light salsa consistency. Stir to mix ingredients.
